channel.title: Failed fcsk
channel.description:
Hi..
I have a problem with loading Whonix Workstation.
I get a message about some inconsistency. fcsk fails. Mounting fails. Manual mounting fails. Manual mounting with read-only requests root password. Root password is not accepted. Default password 'user' is also not accepted. Restart does the same. Recovery mode as well.
Updated recently.
The one snapshot that I have seems to be broken. Any suggestions?

item.title: Failed fcsk
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
As far as I know… Unless you find more clever advice as per https://www.whonix.org/wiki/About#Based_on_Debian.

Read full topic

item.title: Failed fcsk
item.dc:creator: error1
item.description:
So the only way is to re-install whonix and loose all my data?

Read full topic

item.title: Failed fcsk
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
We recommend against using VBox snapshots. (https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Security_Guide#Recommendation_to_use_multiple_VM_Snapshots)

Last time I had such an issue, I haven’t found a way to fix it after extended research.

Read full topic

item.title: Failed fcsk
item.dc:creator: error1
item.description:
Hi…

I have a problem with loading Whonix Workstation.

I get a message about some inconsistency. fcsk fails.
Mounting fails. Manual mounting fails.
Manual mounting with read-only requests root password.
Root password is not accepted. Default password ‘user’ is also not accepted.
Restart does the same. Recovery mode as well.

Updated recently.

The one snapshot that I have seems to be broken.
Any suggestions?
